alert.note: Alert for Lower Jefferson; Lower Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 9:24AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, SOUTHEASTERN ST. JAMES, ST. CHARLES, WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS, NORTH CENTRAL TERREBONNE, SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON, SOUTHEASTERN TANGIPAHOA, NORTHERN LAFOURCHE AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON PARISHES THROUGH 1015 AM CST... At 923 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Ponchatoula to near Edgard to near Thibodaux. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Thibodaux, Reserve, Avondale, Metairie, Hahnville, Laplace, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Lockport, Mathews, Schriever, Montz, Luling, Garyville, and River Ridge. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 198 and 243. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
